Test Name: Pneumonia PCR with Aerobic Culture and Gram Stain
Specimen Type: Respiratory specimens (sputum, bronchoalveolar lavage, endotracheal aspirate, pleural fluid, nasopharyngeal swabs in viral transport media)
Purpose: To detect and identify pathogens causing pneumonia through PCR amplification, aerobic culture, and Gram stain analysis.
Container: Sterile, leak-proof container for respiratory specimens or viral transport media tube for nasopharyngeal swabs
Equipment: PCR thermal cycler, incubator (35-37 Â°C), biological safety cabinet, microcentrifuge, microscope
